titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Small Manuscript Collections
titlestmt.author: Katie Salzmann

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-23 14:04:49 -0500.

change.item: Revised for ArchivesSpace by Katie Salzmann

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Small Manuscript Collections
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site. Advance notice is required for use: https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/makearesearchappointment.html.
did.abstract: Small Manuscript Collections consists of material acquired by the Wittliff either through gift or purchase that are not part of a larger collection. They are often indiidual items or small groups of items relating to a particular author, musician, photographer, or topic. Types of material include: manuscripts; letters; photographs; ephemera such as pamphlets, brouchures or cataloges; reports; historical documents; and other printed material. Each item or group of items is assigned a unique number such as SMC-0001, SMC-0002, SMC-0003, etc. that serves as the call number for the respective small collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: SMC [Number] [Title], The Wittliff Collections, Texas State University.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Small Manuscript Collections consists of material acquired by the Wittliff either through gift or purchase that are not part of larger collections. They are often indiidual items or small groups of items relating to a particular author, musician, photographer, or topic. Types of material include: manuscripts; letters; photographs; ephemera such as pamphlets, brouchures or cataloges; reports; historical documents; and other printed material. Each item or group of items is assigned a unique number such as SMC-0001, SMC-0002, SMC-0003, etc. that serves as the call number for the respective small collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials from the Wittliff Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. The user assumes responsibility for determining copyright status, obtaining permission to publish, and abiding by U.S. copyright laws. https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/visit/policies/publication.html

did.unittitle: William H. Goetzmann manuscript

Manuscript by William Goetzmann of introduction to William H. Emory Report on the United States and Mexican Boundary Survey published in a Texas State Historical Association reprint of the Emory report.
W. Thomas Taylor collection

Broadsides and ephemera printed by publisher, printer, and antiquarian bookseller W. Thomas Taylor. Includes new book announcements, catalogues, business promotional material, programs, poetry, personal announcements, and a page proof.
Horton Foote collection
Copy of screenplay "Nineteen Eighteen," Signed, 101 typed pages
Publicity booklet for "The Trip to the Bountiful." 8 leaves, signed
Typed copy of Foote's vita, 1 page
John C. Duval letter
Letter from John C. Duval to Churchill Fulshea
Noah Smithwick records
"Biographical sketch of the author" by Nanna Smithwick Donaldson about Noah Smithwick. 1 page, handwritten.

Legal document written by William R. Hancock, acting justice of the peace in Bastrop County, Republic of Texas. Document concerns Noah Smithwick and William A. Clapton who provided sworn statements as to the value of a horse captured by the Comanches. 1 page, handwritten.
Ancel Nunn drawing
Original pen and ink preliminary drawing by Ancel Nunn for "A Personal Country" by A.C. Greene
W. Thomas Taylor collection on Gertrude Beasley

Souvenir booklet for meeting of the Book Club of Texas containing a reprint of H.L. Mencken's review of My First Thirty Years by Gertrude Beasley, titled "A Texas Schoolmarm" which originally appeared in the January 1926 issue of The American Mercury.

Page proofs for 1989 edition of My First Thirty Years, printed by W. Thomas Taylor for the Austin Book Club. Missing pp. 236-237 and colophon. Included are the title page and two sheets of uncut proofs.
Ace Reid photograph with J. Frank Dobie
Black and white photograph of Ace Reid with J. Frank Dobie at a book signing
Robert (Bob) Wade collection
Resume, 26 typed pages, signed
"Bob Wade: Projects and Photoworks", a promotional booklet for a show, including a signed pen and ink self-portrait on the title page
Announcement for "Bob Wade: Photo Works" exhibition with handwritten note to Bill Wittliff
Two cards featuring Wade's original artwork
Postcard to Encino Press in Austin, Texas announcing an exhibition
Letter from Stephen Nagy to Bob Wade
Photocopies of articles discussing Wade's work
Complete issues of Pasatiempo and The Santa Fean Magazine
Flyer from Posters of Santa Fe featuring Wade's art
Handmade Christmas card to the Wittliff family from Bob and Lisa Wade
John H. Jenkins collection
Signed note from author and publisher John H. Jenkins to Bill Wittliff written on a copy of "Why minors should vote", by John Jenkins, published in the December 1957 American Mercury
Complete copy of December 1957American Mercury with a letter from Jenkins to Bill Wittliff written on the second page
Paperback copy of "The General's Tight Pants: Edward Warren's Texas Tour of 1836" ed. by John H. Jenkins, sent as a Christmas greeting

Paperback of "Robert E. Lee on the Rio Grande: The Corrospondence of Robert E. Lee on the Texas Border, 1860" ed. by John H. Jenkins, and published by the Jenkins Publishing Company. Sent as a Christmas greeting , with original envelope
Paperback of "Memoir of Capt'n C. R. Perry of Johnson City, Texas, a Texas Veteran", ed. by Kenneth Kesselus, published by the Jenkins Publishing Company and sent as a Christmas greeting
Webb family collection on Jose Cisneros
Exhibit notices and copies of news clippings from artist Jose Cisneros. Includes 3 handwritten notes from Cisneros to Bridget and Wilfred Webb.
Sarah Bird interview with Dave Hickey transcript
Typed transcript of Sarah Bird's Spring 1993 interview with Dave Hickey. Includes a typed note from transcriber Sarah Lowry.
Michael Hall interview transcripts
Transcript of interview by Michael Hall with Steve Harrigan, Larry Wright, and Sarah Bird. Typed with edits in pen. Transcribed by Sarah Lowry
Transcript of interview by Michael Hall with Larry L. King. Typed with edits in pen. Transcribed by Sarah Lowry
Edwin "Bud" Shrake manuscript, Harvey Penick's Little Red Book

Original typed manuscript with editing notations for Harvey Penick's Little Red Book lessons and teachings from a lifetime in golf by Harvey Penick with Bud Shrake, published 1992. Includes typesetting and design material, a letter to Shrake from the publisher, and a note to Bill Wittliff from Shrake. Manuscript is approximately 196 pages.
Edwin "Bud" Shrake draft, And If You Play Golf, You're my Friend
Edwin "Bud" Shrake draft, And If You Play Golf, You're my Friend
Willie Morris collection
Handwritten letter from Willie Morris to Bud Shrake
Photocopy of letter from Governor Ann Richards to Willie Morris
Three clippings discussing Willie Morris' writing
J. Rhett Rushing manuscript
Typed manuscript of "Horsetrading and Ethics" by J. Rhett Rushing
Joe Holley collection
Typed copy of Austin Chronicle article by Joe Holley about author Americo Paredes
Mary Brown McSwain manuscripts
Spiral bound typed copies of "My Adventures with Transportation", part 6
Spiral bound typed copies of "My Adventures with Transportation", part 7
Don Graham collection on The Gay Place
Two typed drafts of Don Graham's introduction to The Gay Place: Being Three Related Novels by Billy Lee Brammer
Cover for new edition of The Gay Place
Don Graham collection on Pretty Boy Floyd
Press release for Pretty Boy Floyd by Larry McMurtry and Diana Ossana
Article titled "The Authors Talk About Their Collaboration"
Scott Slovic interview with Rick Bass

Weber Studies: An Interdisciplinary Humanities Journal, edited by Scott Slovic and Neila C. Seshachari. First page is signed with a note from Scott Slovic. Includes Slovic's interview with Rick Bass titled "A Paint Brush in One Hand and a Bucket of Water in the Other: Nature Writing and the Politics of Wilderness."
Brandt Andrew Rydell thesis

Honors thesis "The Dusky Demon: Profile of a Black Rodeo Cowboy" about Bill Pickett. Submitted in partial fulfillment of the requirements of honors studies in history at J. Fullbright College of Arts and Sciences
Texas ephemera collection
Program for "Waldemar Rodeo and Round-up, final banquet"
"Texas and the Centennial" booklet, Dallas
"Texas in Transition: A Sesquicentennial Forum", program
Blank notepad with cover design depicting a cowboy riding a wild horse
Robert Sparkman collection on Jose Cisneros
Correspondence with artist Jose Cisneros. Some letter and notes are written on news clipping and publications containing his art
Complete issue of Southwestern Art V. 4 no. 4 containing an article about Cisneros
Catalog for Michael Gibbs, bookseller containing an original illustration by Cisneros
American Book Collector V. 23 no. 2 with cover illustration by Cisneros
El Paso Magazine, containing original illustration by Cisneros
Program for the 21st annual conference of the Texas Council for the Social Studies with illustration and script by Cisneros
El Paso Physician with cover illustration by Cisneros
Program for the United States Military Academy Library exhibit featuring Cisneros, containing and original drawing
Cover for "Death Was the Black Horse" by Dale L. Walker, with cover illustration by Cisneros
Cover for "Teresita" by William Curry Holden, illustrated by Cisneros
Program for "Jose Cisneros at Paisano" from the Institute of Texan Cultures, University of Texas System
Robert Sparkman collection on M.T. "Lone Wolf" Gonzaullas
Three black and white photographs of Texas Ranger M.T. "Lone Wolf" Gonzaullas, inscribed to Sparkman
Aldredge Book Store advertisement publicizing he purchase of Gonzaullas's book collection, with handwritten note from Gonzaullas to Sparkman
Post card with color photograph of Gonzaullas
Blank copy of Ranger Daily Scout Report
Pamphlet titled "Texas Rangers" from the Texas Department of Public Safety
Robert Sparkman collection on David W. Guion
Program from "The Songs of David W. Guion" at the Baylor School of Music"
Pamphlet titled " The music of David Guion"
Clippings related Guion, some original newsprint
Correspondence between Sparkman and Guion
Typed copy of lyrics to "Mary Alone"--words by Lucile Isabell Stall, music by David W. Guion
Black and white photograph of Guion, inscribed to Sparkman
Musical score and lyrics to "Home of the Range", handwritten by Guion and inscribed to Sparkman
Luis Guillermo Guerra solar plate
One of the 45 pieces of of the solar plate etching used to make the print Omecihuatl
Robert Sparkman correspondence with Ralph Yarborough

Cards and letters between Ralph Yarborough and Robert Sparkman including two printings of a Christmas pamphlet containing Yarborough's speech on the dedication of the Sam Houston stamp. The pamphlet was designed by Bill Wittliff and published by Encino Press. The stamp was designed by Tom Lea. Pamphlet is signed by Wittliff, Lea, and Ralph and Opal Yarborough
Correspondence between Robert Sparkman and Tom and Sarah Lea, 1995
Letters to Bill Wittliff
Clay Reynolds collection of book covers and ephemera
New Growth 2 ed. Mark Busby
New Growth ed. by Lyman Grant (2 copies)
This Place of Memory, A Texas Perspective ed. by Joyce Gibson Roach
Promotional flyer for Streets of Laredo, by Larry McMurtry
Elmer Kelton "John Graves Day" address
Two copies of typescript for Elmer Kelton's address at "John Graves Day" held at the Dallas Museum of Art
A. C. Greene "John Graves Day" address
Two drafts of Greene's address for "John Graves Day" held at the Dallas Museum of Art
Don Graham "John Graves Day" draft
Draft of Graham's address for "John Graves Day", held at the Dallas Museum of Art
David Rice typescripts and ephemera
"The Circumstances Surrounding My Penis," by David Rice. Typescript
"El Sapo," by David Rice. Typescript
Promotional postcard signed by David Rice with note to Steve Davis
James E. Crisp "Texas History, Texas Mystery" article

Photocopy of Crisp's notes and two drafts for his essay "Texas History, Texas Mystery" which was published in Sallyport: The Magazine of Rice University. Complete issue of the magazine, with Crisp's picture on the cover included.
John Slate Zine Collection

Game-Caller News, volume 1, number 1. Contains three articles by Larry L. King --one under his own name (p. 2), one under the pseudonym Gaylord M. Brooks (p. 1), and one under the pseudonym Ransom Jackson (p. 3)
Mary Winfield McComb collection on Alfred Benjamin Fontaine Kerr

scopecontent.head: Series Description
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to Alfred Benjamin Fontaine Kerr, Methodist minister and first mayor of San Marcos

Letter from Billy Lee Brammer to Larry L. King

A letter from Eddie Durham's son about to the New Jersey Jazz Society
Michael Hall's Lubbock interview transcripts

scopecontent.head: Series Description
scopecontent.p: Transcripts of interviews with multiple individuals about the Lubbock, Texas music history. Interviewees/subjects include Lloyd Maines, Jo Carol Pierce, Waylon Jennings, Angela Strehli, Delbert McClinton, Terry Allen, Joe Ely, Jimmy Dale Gilmore, and Butch Hancock among others.

did.unittitle: Copies of transcripts of interviews between Michael Hall of Texas Monthly. Some transcripts are in email format and there are two transcripts where the interviewee is not clearly identified.
Texas Press Association collection on Laura Furman
Biographical information and promotional material about author Laura Furman
Decherd Turner letters
Letters to Decherd Turner from Lewis Nordyke, J. Frank Dobie, A. C. Greene, Elithe Hamilton, Loula Grace Erdman, Roy Bedichek, and William E. Barrett
Josephine Etlinger promotional material
Promotional material for Sweetest You Can Find by Josephine Etlinger
Tex Ritter sheet music
Sheet music for "Christmas Carols by the Old Corral" by Johnny Lange and Archie Gottler. Recorded by Tex Ritter, published by Texas Ritter Music Publications

Photocopy of typescript of "The Hawk That Missed His Aim" by J. Frank Dobie with handwritten notes

"Eddie Durham: Jazz man had his roots in San Marcos" by Carol Coughlin. Appeared in the San Marcos Record

Farm Aid informational packet which contains a folder, brochure, program, newsletter, letter about Farm Aid
Connie Todd collection on The Red Headed Stranger

scopecontent.head: Series Description
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to the production of The Red Headed Stranger. Connie Todd was casting director and director's assistant. Wittliff was the screenwriter, director, and co-exuctive producer.

did.unittitle: Rosters, daily reports, shooting schedules, call sheets, phone messages, production crew lists, handwritten "to do" lists
Austin-Bergstrom International Airport music schedules
Performance schedules for the Hill Country Bar and Highland Lakes Bar at the Austin-Bergstrom International Airport
John Graves book covers
Seventeen book covers for Goodbye to a River by John Graves
Walter Prescott and Terrell Webb photographs
Eight black and white photographs. One of Walter Prescott Webb, three of Terrell Webb, and four of them together
Betty Hannstein Adams typescript
Typescript of "An Unexpected Dividend" (The correspondence between Walter Prescott Webb and Terrell Maverick Webb), edited by Betty Hannstein Adams, with corrections
Selena fan photograph
Photograph of a fan holding an image of Tejano singer, Selena [8" x 10"] black/white
Dick Heaberlin academic paper for John Graves Symposium
Typescript of "Of Dachshunds and Dashes: Subjects and Style in E. B. White and John Graves," written for the "Presentation of Academic Papers" for the John Graves symposium
Katherine Anne Porter Preservation Project plans
Letter and planning documents related to the renovation of the Katherine Anne Porter House in Kyle, TX
James Langston academic paper for John Graves Symposium
Typescript of "'Pie en la Patria': Speaking landscape and new pastoral in "Goodbye to a River", written for the "Presentation of Academic Papers" for the John Graves symposium
Suzanne Winckler collection on "Women of Texas Monthly"

scopecontent.head: Series Description
scopecontent.p: Materials from "Women of Texas Monthly", a project developed by Suzanne Winckler.

did.unittitle: Narrative by Suzanne Winckler about the project
Photocopies of the "Women of Texas Monthly" group photographs
Tears sheet from an issue of Texas Monthly with the women's names highlighted
Notes, invoices, correspondence
Photographs with descriptions. Includes one 8" x 10" color photograph of the entire group.
Suzanne Winckler letters
Letters to Suzanne Winckler from John and Jane Graves, Steve Harrigan, Robert Frank, William Broyles, Jr. and John Henry Faulk
Correspondence between Suzanne Winckler and John McPhee
Letter to the Editorial and Art Department of Texas Monthly from Dominique Browning and letter about Browning from "GrCu" to the staff
Photocopy of a letter addressed to "Dick," with a handwritten note in the margins to Suzanne Winckler from Rosemary.
Suzanne Winckler collection of Joe Greene
Copy of article Suzanne Winckler wrote about Joe Greene in January 1984 issue of Texas Monthy titled "Remember the Alamo--and Duz and Lux" Sheet music for "Across the Alley from the Alamo" by Greene
Sheet music for "Across the Alley from the Alamo" by Joe Greene
Austin-Bergstrom International Airport event tickets
Two tickets to the grand opening celebration of the Austin-Bergstrom International Airport with guest President Bill Clinton
President George W. and First Lady Laura Bush photograph
Photograph of President and First Lady Bush in front of a menorah. Inscribed to Mara Elizabeth Levy an signed by the Bushes [8" x 10"] color
Rocky Schenck postcard
One postcard, not mailed, with a note from Schenck indicating that his grandfather, William Henry Huddle painted the card's artwork "The Surrender of Santa Ana"
Arjen van der Sluis collection on Mariana Yampolsky
Photocopies of articles on Mariana Yampolsky and a press release
El Paso Museum of Art brochures
Two brochures for the El Paso Museum of Art's exhibition titled "Crossing Over: Photographs and New Video Installations by Willie Varela"

Broadside created for Texas Literary Outlaws by Steve Davis. 9" x 12" black and white broadside is signed by Whitehead and numbered 7/10
Austin Film Festival promotional material
Passes, invitations, flyers, and tote bag from the Austin Film Festival
Hecho en Tejas Day proclamations
House Resoluntion no. 285, declaring February 10th as Hecho en Tejas Day at the Texas State Capitol. 4 copies. Each has the official state seal

Transcript of Margaret Wead's interview with Jovita Mireles
Encino Press pamphlet
"A Private Press Profile" pamphlet about Encino Press from the MLA Quarterly
Tommy Lee Jones poem
"Doggerel" typed peom by Tommy Lee Jones, signed and dated, Tesuque, New Mexico
El Progreso promotional materials
Promotional materials for El Progreso, 1939-1940: The Work of Rodolfo Zepeda Mirabal and Dora Cervera Mirabal, by Rosie Mirabal Garza. Includes a bookmark, booklet and acknowledgements

Correspondence between author Harriet Doerr and bibliographer, J. Howard Woolmer
Cormac McCarthy interview on the Oprah Winfrey Show
VHS tape and two DVD copies of Cormac McCarthy's interview on the Oprah Winfrey Show
Honeysuckle Rose press kit

Press kit for Honeysuckle Rose. Includes articles about stars Willie Nelson, Dyan Cannon, Slim Pickens and Amy Irving, producer Gene Taft, director Jerry Schatzberg, and executive producer Sydney Pollack.
Full cast and crew list for Honeysuckle Rose
3 black and white photographs of Honeysuckle Rose
Stevie Ray Vaughan Double Trouble poster
Poster for Stevie Vaughan and Double Trouble. Handwritten at the bottom: "Every Tuesday in April Cheatham Street"
Trinity University alumni letters
Photocopies of letters from Trinity University alumni reflecting on the Ruth Taylor Theater
Edwin "Bud" Shrake and Dan Jenkins screenplay
Typed copy of screenplay for "Beverly Hills Cop II" by Edwin "Bud" Shrake and Dan Jenkins. First page is dated and says "First Draft"
Austin City Limits program
Austin City Limits program from the episode featuring Radney Foster and Kelly Willis. Front cover is signed with a note by Foster
Dick J. Reavis essays
Copies of Dick Reavis' essays for "The Rag" blog
Bill Moyers' Journal transcript
Transcript from episode of Bill Moyers' Journal called "John Graves: The Head Varmint of Hard Scrabble." Transcript consists of an interview between Moyers and Graves
Alton and Irene Schwarz photograph

Photograph of curb where Bill Wittliff wrote his name in the cement. He wrote "Billy Wittliff June 3, 1950." Includes a page from the donors explaining the story behind the photograph [8" x 10"] color
Jim Kimmel typescript and photographs

controlaccess.subject: San Marcos River (Tex.) -- Description and travel

did.unittitle: Typescript of draft for Jim Kimmel's book, The San Marcos: A River's Story. Includes 8 color photographs and a letter from Kimmel to Connie Todd of the Wittliff Collections
Peggy Walters collection on the founding of J. Frank Dobie High School
Photocopies of letters, card and a program related to the founding and dedication of J. Frank Dobie High School in Houston, Texas
J. Frank Dobie photographs
Three photographs of J. Frank Dobie
Lucky Attal collection on Francisco "Pancho" Villa

Pamphlet, cover title--"Pancho Villa: Terror of Mexico, Descriptive Illustrated History of the Mexican Revolution" by Max Stein, 1916. p. 3 is signed by J. Frank Dobie with a note "as scarce as hen's teeth"
One photograph of Villa with the negative. Inscription on back indicates the picture was taken in Mexico City, early in his career
One group photograph with Villa and Pershing identified
Leonard Sanders letter
Letter to Blankenship from Leonard Sanders
Brant Bingamon interview with Bud Shrake
Copies of a series of emails in which Bingamon interviews Shrake
De Pree Art Center and Gallery brochures
Brochures for two exhibitions: Loteria: Artists' Variations of the Traditional Mexican Game (2003) and Steve Nelson: Solo Flight (1997)
Dorothy Sloan auction catalogues

Catalogues for auction 12 "The Daniel G. Volkmann Jr. Collection of The Zamorano 80" and auction 13 "A Few Good Maps and Manuscripts Touching upon the History of Texas, California, the Southwest, Mexico and the Borderlands."
J. Frank Dobie photograph

Photograph of J. Frank Dobie and friends. Persons identified are Dobie, Mrs. Bertha Dobie, Mrs. Lillian Bedichek, Sue McBee, Bevlan Smith, Clara Lewis, Jack Whithead (son of Clara Lewis) [8.5" x 12.5"] black/white
Katherine Anne Porter photograph
Photograph of Katherine Anne Porter [8" x 10"] black/white
John Graves screenplay
Screenplay by John Graves based on his short story "The Last Running" with revisions by Connie Todd. From cover: "Revised draft for cast reading at Southwestern Writers Collection"
"W. K. ""Kip"" Stratton collection of J. Frank Dobie"
Photocopies of documents pertaining the University of Texas' purchase of J. Frank Dobie's ranch and the establishment of the Paisano writing program
James Kelman letters
Photocopies of letters to James Kelman, predominantly from Mary Gray Hughes
Mary Margaret Farabee collection of Red-Headed Stranger

Clippings, three photographs, promotional materials, correspondence related to the movie Red-Headed Stranger, starring Willie Nelson, written and directed by Bill Wittliff. Includes a promotional postcard signed by Nelson
Jean Granberry Schnitz presentation
Copy of presentation titled "J. Frank Dobie's Brush Country Roots" by Jean Granberry Schnitz given to the Texas Folklore Society. Also inclides a typed draft
Texas Folklore Society programs
Programs for the Texas Folklore Society's annual meetings
N. Scott Momaday clippings and photocopied photographs
Two clippings related to author N. Scott Momaday and eight black and white photocopies of photographs by Scott
Nolan Porterfield collection of Grover Lewis
Letters from Grover Lewis to Nolan Porterfield and Mr. Edel
Photocopy of "Wait for Morning Child: a play in one act" by Grover Lewis
Photocopies of articles articles and poems by Lewis appearing in Renaissance, Notes from the Undergrond and Fort Worth Star Telegram
Photocopies of photographs of Grover Lewis, and two clippings discussing Lewis
Recordings on CD by Porterfield of Lewis reading poetry and singing, along with a copy of the poem "Tom Joad" by Woodie Guthrie
Typed copies of short stories "A Country Man on a Long Day's Journey", and "A Leaden Finger"; poems "Poem for the Wreckage of Children" and "In Loco Parentis"
Texas Book Festival promotional material
Invitation for the Texas Book Festival including a booklet with schedule and list of authors. Feature's Bill Wittliff's photographs from Lonesome Dove
Al Lowman card and poster
New Year's card from Al and Darlyne Lowman and a 12" x 9" gray cardstock print with a portrait of Henry Miller by Barbara Holman and the poem "Imagination"
Ann Rapp remarks on Bud Shrake
Two typed pages of remarks by Ann Rapp at the graveside service for Bud Shrake, dated and signed by Rapp
J. Frank Dobie university transcript

Two copies of J. Frank Dobie's transcript from Columbia University, where he attended from 1912-1914. Includes letters between SWWC, executor of Dobie's estate Cecilia Rohloff, and the registrar's office at Columbia concerning authorization to release the record
Ben Guttery collection of Edwin Lanham
Clippings, correspondence and research materials related to Edwin Lanham, including information about the probate of Lanham's will
Steve Cox collection on Deadhead Miles
Copy of screenplay for Deadhead Miles by Terrence Malick
"Deadhead Miles and me: a rambling reminiscence" by Steve Cox
Charles Shadle score and recording
Score and recording of "Penny Ballad of Elvious Ricks, c. 1927" by Charles Shadle, based on the poetry of R. G. Vliet. Piece is dedicated to Ann Vliet
Preston and Dorris Connally collection of Elithe Hamilton Kirkland
Clippings, poems, reviews, book catalog (in German), postcards, promotional materials, biographical sketch
Richard M. Dalton books on CD
"Padre Island: a novel about the National Park Service and antiquities theft"
"A Photographic Guide to Mexico"
Big Bend National Park brochure and slides
Vintage brochure of Big Bend National Park and eight "Armchair Traveler" slides depicting the park
Robert T. Hill article
Article titled "Running the cañons of the Rio Grande" by Robert T. Hill, published in The Century magazine
Susan Toomey Frost drawings
Drawings with measurements of the design of a mosiac-topped table
Larry McMurtry reading transcript
Two copies of transcript of a reading Larry McMurtry gave at McNeese State University's Creative Writing Program Talk #7
J. Frank Dobie promotional material
Domino Records mailer promoting the record "J. Frank Dobie tells The Ghost Bull of the Mavericks and other tales"
Kiki Wheelock collection of Jeanne Dixon
Clippings, photocopied photograph, letters, and awards related to Jeanne Dixon, co-author of The settlement of Leon Springs, Texas: from Prussia to Persia. Also includes book cover from this book
Kiki Wheelock collection of The Voyage of Islita
Letters, promotional material, review and author biography relating to The Voyage of Islita by Kiki Wheelock
